name: "Preacher" - Season 1: "Call and Response" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the woman Jesse ran past in the opening montage?
questions.explanation:
Mabel.

	A radio broadcast was recapping previous events as if it were a newscast. The show mentioned Eugene was missing, God was expected to be at church on Sunday and that Jesse was sought by the police. Jesse at that moment ran past an elderly lady and screamed "Hi Mabel" as the police cars came up behind him.

questions.text: What did Tulip use to break the door open at Donnie's house?
questions.explanation:
A plastic flamingo.

	Thinking Donnie had kidnapped or otherwise harmed Jesse, she broke into the house using the lawn decoration and started yelling at Donnie. Donnie's eardrums still hadn't recovered from a previous injury suffered a few episodes earlier.  Jesse was in the shower at the time, in Donnie's house.

questions.text: Cassidy was in jail at the start of the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He was first shown laying on a bench in a jail cell talking to a man dressed as an American Indian. He had been arrested at the local brothel by Sheriff Root, who was seeking out his missing son Eugene.

questions.text: What was hidden in Tulip's trunk when she showed Jesse outside of Donnie's house?
questions.explanation:
A person.

	Tulip had finally gone to seek vengeance on Carlos in the previous episode. To this point all viewers knew was that she wanted revenge on him, but not why. She kidnapped him and put him in the trunk of her car, demanding that Jesse kill him. A flashback at that point helped to explain what he had done wrong to both Jesse and Tulip.

questions.text: Did Tulip get her revenge on Carlos by killing him?
questions.explanation:
No.

	She begged Jesse to kill him, but stopped him just before he did it. She set him free, gave him a tire iron and then Jesse gave him a pistol. The two of them then worked together to beat him senseless, though it happened off camera.

questions.text: What did Jesse expect to get out of his phone call with God?
options: He expected God to save the town.
They planned to poison him and leave him to die.
questions.explanation:
He didn't have any idea.

	Talking to Tulip before he walked into the rectory at the church, he told her he had no idea what to expect. Tulip hugged him, and said that no matter what they were getting french fries after the service.

questions.text: Who interrupted Jesse before he had a chance to make his phone call to God?
questions.explanation:
Odin.

	Odin jumped up in front of the crowd and gave his own speech about what to expect that day in the church. His speech included a line about how the only real God was the god of meat.

questions.text: Who was the first to speak to "God" after he appeared in the church?
questions.explanation:
Jesse.

	Jesse told him that they had questions, and God then, in a booming voice, screamed at them for having questions. Tulip then tried to scream at him. He said that "I am" was the only answer they needed and then Jesse also spoke to him about why the people deserved an answer to their questions. The man who appeared however turned out not to be God, but an imposter in Heaven because the real God was missing. Jesse used his power to make the angelic imposter tell everyone in the church about their missing saviour.

questions.text: Which of the following did NOT happen after the fake "God" appeared in the church?
questions.correct: Jesse renounced God and returned to his life as a criminal.
options: Tracy's mother smothered her while her brother took a selfie with it happening in the background.
The school bus driver was murdered.
Odin built himself a new daughter out of ground meat.
questions.explanation:
Jesse renounced God and returned to his life as a criminal.

	The school bus driver was killed by the girls who he had been molesting earlier in the season, and the other two answer choices happened as described. Several other big things happened too: the methane reactor got too hot and melted down, Emily explained to her children why they didn't need God and that their father was still in heaven, and the church congregation got in a huge brawl and trashed the church interior. The entire church was then destroyed when the methane was released. Jesse, Tulip and Cassidy went for french fries.

questions.text: With his church destroyed, Jesse decided to set out on a mission to find and help God since the entire town of Annville was destroyed in the methane explosion.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Though only the church was shown to be destroyed on camera, a news report in the diner where Jesse, Tulip and Cassidy were eating announced the entire town had been blown up. Jesse vowed to find and help God if he needed help, and to get Eugene out of Hell. The trio then drove off into the horizon to await season two of the series.
